page.title: 15THE MOTORWAY
page.content: THE M56 MOTORWAY RUNS THROUGH A CORNER OF OUR AREA. IT IS PART OF THE MOTORWAY SYSTEM WHICH LINKS THE M6 TO NORTH WALES. IT WAS OPENED IN 1971 ON SUNDAY FEBRUARY 21ST. BEFORE IT WAS OPENED THERE WERE MANY ACCIDENTS ON THE A56 IN HELSBY INVOLVING MANY VEHICLES. SOME OF THESE ACCIDENTS WERE FATAL. IT WAS VERY DANGEROUS FOR CHILDREN GOING TO SCHOOL. IT WAS ESTIMATED THAT OVER 6,OOO VEHICLES A DAY WERE PASSING THROUGH HELSBY. ON SOME DAYS IT TOOK 1O-15 MINUTES TO CROSS THE ROAD, HUGE QUEUES OF TRAFFIC BUILT UP. THERE WERE TRAFFIC JAMS HEADING TOWARDS RUNCORN EVERYDAY. IT WAS EXTREMELY NOISY.SO WE DECIDED TO SEE WHAT IMPROVEMENT THE M56 HAD MADE WE DECIDED TO DO A TRAFFIC SURVEY TO SEE: 1. HOW MANY VEHICLES WERE TRAVELLING ON THE MOTORWAY.
